SENT.plain: Recurrent thromboembolic accidents are frequent complications of BehÃ§et's disease
Ten patients were investigated, 5 of them during an acute exacerbation of the disease
Abnormal responses to the venostasis test and to DDAVP (i.v.) were demonstrated in acute cases

Factor VIII activities after DDAVP were increased in all 10 patients, which suggests that the response of the vascular endothelium to the stimulus was normal and that a fibrinolytic system inhibitor may be present in the plasma of some patients
